author: James Joyce
text: My particularly pouting Nora, I told you I would write to you. Now you write to me and tell me what the deuce was the matter with you last night. I am sure something was wrong. You looked to me as if you were sorry for something which had not happened—that would would [sic] be very like you. I have been trying to console my hand ever since but can’t. Where will you be on Saturday night, Sunday night, Monday night, that I can’t see you? Now, adieu, dearest. I kiss the miraculous dimple at thy neck, Thy Christian Brother-in-Luxuriousness J.A.J. When you come next leave sulks at home—also stays
